body:
TEXT/BOX SHADOW. It's nice, although I think adding it gives us multiple simultaneous visual styles, which is a bit jarring. I defer to @rehandalal for visual design.

The layout of the status indicators is inconsistent with and without the review comment boxes. With comment:

![screen shot 2017-05-10 at 13 48 13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/193106/25920674/94e03a28-3587-11e7-91be-5ba57960aefd.png)

Without comment:

![screen shot 2017-05-10 at 13 49 02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/193106/25920677/96dfde5a-3587-11e7-9672-7377a738e49f.png)

My armchair-designer suggestion would be to nix the box around the name field (since there's no heading to that grouping, the grouping itself is unnecessary), and flexbox it with the two indicators on the right (vertically stacking them in a container div), giving them no flex so that they stay at their initial width, letting the name box flex to take the rest of the space. 

When the comment's there we can just push everything down, including the indicators. In a followup PR we should probably move this, maybe only showing it in a tooltip if you hover over the "Approved" indicator?
